title: Atlantic Canada Center for Disease Ecology Modelling (ACCDMi)
text:
Welcome to ACCDMi
The Atlantic Canada Center for Disease Ecology Modelling (ACCDMi) is a multidisciplinary research initiative to advance the science and application of infectious disease modelling to improve human and animal health.
We consolidate expertise from five AARMS member institutions, representing all four Atlantic Canadian provinces.
ACCDMi supports visibility, capacity-building, and collaboration in infectious disease modelling so stakeholders, public health professionals, and experts in adjacent disciplines can discover and engage our experts in applied problems.

title: Activities
text:
Proposed Activities

ACCDMi Website — hosted via GitHub Pages.

Collaboration Fund — support for trainee projects.

Semiannual virtual research and networking events.

Between-institution collaboration and colloquia.

Local outreach — courses, materials, workshops.

AARMS Summer School 2027 — hosted at Bonne Bay Marine Station.

title: Research Themes
text:
ACCDMi researchers use data science, applied mathematics, statistics, and AI to advance disease ecology modelling.


Projects: Avian influenza models, spillover risk, amphibian disease ecology.



Projects: Inference for stochastic models, epidemic forecasting, spatial-temporal risk in small communities, outbreak modelling, stochastic control, and advocacy for small jurisdictions.



Projects: Hybrid dispersal models, imperfect vaccination, tumour models with therapy, seasonality and dispersal, and optimal control strategies.



Projects: Online outreach resources, local outreach events, and training workshops.

title: About ACCDMi
text:
About
The Atlantic Canada Center for Disease Ecology Modelling (ACCDMi) will consolidate and describe our expertise. Programs will build relationships and capacity through training, outreach, and collaborative partnerships.
We focus on:

Improving analyses by incorporating efficient algorithms, modelling approaches, and perspectives from applied mathematics and statistics.

Supporting small jurisdictions that face unique modelling needs.

Advocating for mathematics and statistics to be recognized as essential in applied health sciences.

ACCDMi is a step toward establishing a national modelling institute and ensuring that Atlantic Canada is a strong contributor to future national initiatives.
